#summary InstallVision

= Installing the OpenNERO Vision Extension =

Follow the steps below to install the vision extension to OpenNERO.

==1. Get a fresh version of OpenNERO==

One of the following steps should help get you up and running in OpenNERO:

  * Install it on your own machine by downloading one of the [DownloadingOpenNero prebuilt binaries].
  * [BuildingOpenNero Build OpenNero] on your own machine using the source code.

Once you have the standard distribution of OpenNERO, you need to <a href="http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users/risto/cs343/private/hw5/Hw5.tar.gz">download the skeleton files</a> for this assignment. Extract the folder Hw5 inside your OpenNERO installation folder.

==2. Install the Python Imaging Library==

We are going to be using the <a href="http://www.pythonware.com/products/pil/">Python Imaging Library</a> to help with loading, saving, and manipulating the images we take in OpenNERO. If you do not already have it installed, see the [InstallPIL install instructions].

==3. Install `numpy` and `scipy`==

You will need to <a href="http://www.scipy.org/Installing_SciPy">install numpy and scipy</a> if you are not already able to import them.
